About_#4: In 2013, the firm merged with Jefferies and Steinberg became chairman. The combined company changed its name to Jefferies Financial Group in 2018.

About_#1: Bhawari Bai Surana is the matriarch of the Surana family, which controls Banaglore pharma firm Micro Labs.
About_#2: The generics company makes drugs for cardiac diseases, diabetes and pain management. It also makes ophthalmic products for Bausch & Lomb's Asia-Pacific market.
About_#3: The privately held company gets nearly 60% of its annual revenue of from the domestic market.
About_#4: Her sons Dilip and Anand run the $588 million (fiscal 2021 sales) company.

Education: Bachelor of Engineering, Kyoto University
About_#1: Masaru Tange founded software quality assurance and testing company Shift in 2005, after working as an engineering consultant.
About_#2: It posted nearly $420 million in revenue in the fiscal year ended in November 2021.
About_#3: Shift's compounded annual growth rate of sales and net profit over the past five years has been more than 50%.
About_#4: The firm listed on Tokyo's JASDAQ exchange for startups in 2014 and eventually moved to the Tokyo Stock Exchange's First Section in 2019.

About_#1: Dennis Uy and his wife Maria founded Converge ICT Solutions, one of the Philippines' largest operators of high-speed internet.
About_#2: They took the company public in 2020, raising more than $500 million in what was one of the Philippines' largest IPOs in recent years.
About_#3: Maria serves as the company's president, Dennis as its CEO. The couple remains majority owners of the company.
About_#4: Converge ICT's fixed broadband services now reach more than 9.6 million homes in 440 cities and municipalities in the Philippines.
Did You Know?: Dennis used to work as a maintenance boy, tinkering refrigerators at his uncle's business.

About_#1: Peter-Alexander Wacker owns around 10% of chemical company Wacker Chemie AG, founded by his great-grandfather Alexander Wacker in 1914.
About_#2: He worked for BMW for ten years before joining Wacker Chemie in 1993 as a member of the board, when it was still a privately owned company.
About_#3: When Wacker went public in November 2005, Peter-Alexander became CEO. In 2008, he stepped down and became chairman of the supervisory board.
About_#4: Wacker Chemie has an annual revenue of more than $6 billion and sells its products in over 100 countries.
Did You Know?: Peter-Alexander Wacker was named family business man of the year in Germany in 2006.

Education: Bachelor of Arts/Science, Rikkyo University
About_#1: Shigefumi Wada is president and founder of publicly-traded software and IT firm Obic Business Consultants.
About_#2: Obic Business Consultants is known for its cloud accounting services and its television ads featuring a kabuki actor.
About_#3: Wada started the business in 1980; his wife Hiroko is a senior managing director and a board member.
About_#4: Together Wada and his wife own a significant stake in the company.

About_#1: Wang Qiangxiang chairs CoCreation Grass, or CCGrass, the self-described largest synthetic turf supplier in the world.
About_#2: CCGrass is used for athletic and landscape purposes.
About_#3: CCGrass supplies sports organizations including FIFA, FIH, World Rugby, GAA and ITF.
About_#4: CCGrass was founded by Wang Qiangxiang and his brother Wang Qiangzhong in 2004 in Nanjing.

Education: Bachelor of Science, Wuhan University of Technology
About_#1: Xiong Shaoming is a cofounder of Smoore International, a supplier of vaping devices, and one of China's first vaping billionaires.
About_#2: Smoore International Holdings supplies components for vaping devices to Japan Tobacco, British American Tobacco and NJOY.
About_#3: The company went public in July 2020, raising more than $900 million on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange.
About_#4: Chen Zhiping, Smoore's cofounder and chairman, is also a billionaire.

About_#1: Shintaro Yamada founded the online used-goods marketplace, Mercari, in 2013 and is the company's CEO.
About_#2: Yamada launched the online marketplace focusing on smartphone users. It had achieved unicorn status by 2016.
About_#3: Mercari's shares have more than doubled since 2020 on an online-buying boom during the pandemic.
About_#4: The company gave each employee a grant of $550 to cover the cost of working from home during the coronavirus pandemic.
Did You Know?: Yamada is a big fan of retired Japanese pitcher Hideo Nomo, who played Nippon Professional Baseball and Major League Baseball.
In Their Own Words: Never be afraid of failure:Go bold.

Education: Bachelor of Science, Tianjin University; Master of Science, University of Science and Technology of China; Master of Science, Yale University
About_#1: Mark Yang, also known as Yang Haoyong, is the chairman of Guazi, an online site that sells second-hand cars.
About_#2: Yang earlier founded online classified site Ganji, which was acquired by 58.com.
About_#3: He holds degrees from Yale University and the University of Science and Technology of China.

About_#1: Former DuPont executive Yao Hsiao Tung acquired Hi-P International as a small tool maker in 1983.
About_#2: Today it is one of Singapore's largest contract manufacturers of smartphones, tablet computers and consumer electronics with customers such as Apple.
About_#3: In 2017, he acquired the stake of longtime partner Molex, owned by billionaire Charles Koch.
About_#4: In April 2021, he delisted the company at a valuation of $1.2 billion, with the aim of securing greater flexibility in running the business.

About_#1: Yao is vice chairman of Oppein Home Group, one of China's largest makers of kitchen appliances and home furniture.
About_#2: His brother Yao Liangsong is chairman of Oppein, who is also a member of the 2021 Forbes Billionaires List.
About_#3: Oppein was founded in Guangzhou in 1994.

About_#1: Ye Qiongjiu is deputy general manager of HithinkRoyalFlush Information Network, an online financial information services business.
About_#2: Ye cofounded the predecessor business of Hithink with its chairman and fellow billioanaire Yi Zheng.
About_#3: Hithink founded Hithinkin Hangzhou in 1994 with 100,000 yuan, currently worth $14,000; it went public in 2009.

Education: Drop Out, Lycoming College
About_#1: Dick Yuengling, fifth-generation owner of D.G. Yuengling & Son, turned his family's struggling brewery into one of America's largest beer makers.
About_#2: When he bought out his father in 1985, the company was producing 137,000 barrels per year; now it pumps out some 2.8 million barrels annually.
About_#3: After dropping out of Lycoming College, Yuengling joined the business but soon walked out following an argument with his father about modernization.
About_#4: He spent 11 years running a beer distributorship peddling Yuengling and its competitors to local bars and stores before buying his father out in 1985.
Did You Know?: Yuengling, America's oldest brewery, first opened its doors in Pottsville, Pennsylvania in 1829 and survived Prohibition by pivoting to ice cream and near beer.
In Their Own Words: I operate on instincts. I don't really think things out.

About_#1: Zhang Yuqiang chairs Zhenshi Holding Group, a conglomerate headquartered in Zhejiang province.
About_#2: Zhenshi's business includes fiberglass products for wind energy, special steel, new composite materials, logistics, minerals, tourism and real estate.
About_#3: Zhenshi set up Zhenshi--Henshi USA Wind Power Materials Corporations in South Carolina in 2016.

About_#1: Zhuang Kuilong chairs Xinfengming Group, a manufacturer of polyester and filament products.
About_#2: Zhuang was reportedly a farmer before a joining a collective fiber factory.
About_#3: Zhuang cofounded the predecessor business of Xinfengming in 2000 with 11 others including his wife Qu Fengqi.
About_#4: Xinfengming listed on Shanghai Stock Exchange in April 2017.
